steps.title: Good luck
steps.content: Good luck In many cultures around the world, hummingbirds are considered a symbol of good fortune and prosperity. So, dreaming about a friendly hummingbird landing on you can signify that good things await you in your waking life. [1] X Research source For example, you might nail a job interview, get a raise at work, or go on a date that leads to a loving relationship.

steps.title: Positive energy
steps.content: Positive energy Hummingbirds never seem to land or stop moving; they’re always darting from flower to flower in the blink of an eye. Seeing a fast-flying hummingbird in your dreams can be a sign to channel their boundless energy, get motivated , and go after your goals . Hummingbirds flap their wings 50 to 200 times per second! To maintain their energy levels, their hearts beat around 500 to 600 times per minute. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Resilience
steps.content: Resilience While hummingbirds might be small in stature, they’re surprisingly strong. These jewel-feathered birds migrate thousands of miles without breaking a sweat and swiftly dodge predators' attacks. [3] X Trustworthy Source The Cornell Lab of Ornithology Research lab of Cornell University dedicated to interpreting and conserving the Earth's biological diversity through research and education about birds Go to source Dreaming about a feisty hummingbird might signify your ability to overcome obstacles that you’re dealing with in your personal and professional life. Take this dream as a sign to face challenges head-on when they come your way. Break your problem down into smaller, more manageable parts and brainstorm ways to solve them.

steps.title: Freedom
steps.content: Freedom Hummingbirds are swift, graceful fliers who are free to change their surroundings whenever they like. Seeing a hummingbird fly in your dream might represent your desire to transform and change your life , whether you’re feeling the itch to move, quit your job, or find a romantic partner. Dreaming about a flying hummingbird can also symbolize something in your life that you want to break free from, like a bad habit, monotonous routine, or toxic relationship.

steps.title: Guidance
steps.content: Guidance Hummingbirds are deeply connected to the divine and are believed to carry messages from the spirit world in many cultures. The friendly hummingbird in your dream might be your guardian angel or spirit guide’s way of contacting you and guiding you on your life path. [4] X Research source If you’re not sure what your spirit guide is trying to tell you, connect with them by meditating . Visualize the hummingbird in your mind and ask your spirit guide what they’re guiding you towards or teaching you. Dreaming about a hummingbird can also signify a spiritual awakening. After seeing one, you might gain clarity about your values and life purpose. Hummingbirds might also represent spiritual healing. If you’re going through a hard time, this dream can be a sign that you’re on the path to recovery.

steps.title: Joy
steps.content: Joy With the hummingbird’s bright, colorful plumage, it’s no surprise they’re associated with happiness and positivity. If you’re happy to see a rainbow-hued hummingbird in your dreams, it might be a sign to take a breather, enjoy the little things, and let joy into your life. For instance, you might start a new hobby , prioritize self-care, and adopt a “Say yes” attitude. Take this dream as a sign to cultivate a more positive mindset . Express gratitude for your life, say positive affirmations, and take daily walks outside to feel refreshed and at peace.

steps.title: Love
steps.content: Love In the world of dreams, hummingbirds are seen as graceful, charming, and mesmerizing animals. Their enchanting appearance can mirror your desire to have love and romance in your life. Seeing a sweet hummingbird in your dreams might be the push you need to meet new people , get your flirt on, and find your soulmate . Because hummingbirds can be positive omens, this dream might be a sign that a new love is making their way to you. Find out how real readers interpret hummingbird symbolism at wikiHow's "Is there a deeper, spiritual meaning to hummingbirds?" forum !

steps.title: A hummingbird landing on you might indicate new beginnings.
steps.content: A hummingbird landing on you might indicate new beginnings. Dreaming about a sweet hummingbird resting on your finger or arm can signify that positive opportunities and transformations are on the horizon. For instance, you might have this dream when a new job or relationship is in the near future. [5] X Research source Take this dream as a sign to accept change in your life. When a good opportunity falls into your lap, go after it!

steps.title: Hugging a hummingbird can mean you’re reaching your dreams.
steps.content: Hugging a hummingbird can mean you’re reaching your dreams. In your dreams, a hummingbird might symbolize your greatest wishes, aspirations, and desires. So, embracing the bird pulls your dreams closer to you, symbolizing all of the hard work you’re making towards achieving your goals . This can indicate that you’re super close to making your dreams a reality ! To reach your dreams, write out what you want to achieve and then break your goal down into concrete, specific steps.

steps.title: Being attacked by a hummingbird can indicate challenges ahead.
steps.content: Being attacked by a hummingbird can indicate challenges ahead. Getting pecked at and chased by an aggressive hummingbird in your dreams can be a sign that problems are revealing themselves in your personal or professional life. For instance, you might find yourself picking fights with your partner, dealing with expensive repairs to your home, or taking on a heavier workload at your job. While this dream can indicate that issues are arising in your life, think of it as a way to help you grow. When you face challenges in your life and relationships, you are gaining the skills and confidence to overcome them.

steps.title: A talking hummingbird might signify self-discovery.
steps.content: A talking hummingbird might signify self-discovery. Having a conversation with a hummingbird in your dreams might feel surreal, but it can be a positive sign that you’re growing and developing into the person you’re meant to be. This is a sign that you’re finding yourself , identifying your passions, and creating the life you want to live. To get to know yourself further, reflect on your values and what’s important to you. This can help you narrow down your passions and set goals for your future.

steps.title: Seeing a dead hummingbird can indicate a chapter is closing.
steps.content: Seeing a dead hummingbird can indicate a chapter is closing. Dreaming about a dead hummingbird can feel distressing and emotional, which might reflect your feelings about a job, relationship, or period of life ending. While you might be scared to close out a chapter of your life, this dream can mean that new opportunities and prosperity are in your future. For example, you might move away from your friends and family but fall in love with the new city you live in. Or, you might leave your job and discover an opening at your dream company.

steps.title: A flying hummingbird might be a reminder to live in the moment.
steps.content: A flying hummingbird might be a reminder to live in the moment. Watching a joyful hummingbird dart and zip through the sky in your dreams can be a nudge to let go of your worries and enjoy the little things in life. So, take this dream as a sign to practice self-care : make weekday plans with friends, dive into a new hobby, treat yourself to ice cream, or take a rejuvenating walk in nature. [6] X Research source To be more present in your daily life, practice mindfulness, do yoga, or meditate.

steps.title: Catching a hummingbird can mean you’re being controlling.
steps.content: Catching a hummingbird can mean you’re being controlling. Dreaming about holding a hummingbird or placing it in a cage might indicate that something in your life is making you feel out of control and unstable, whether it’s your job or a relationship. To regain your sense of control and stability, you might take charge of every situation you can and dictate what others can do. You might feel the need to be in control when you’re stressed and overwhelmed. To calm yourself down, practice deep breathing . Just inhale slowly for 4 seconds, hold your breath for 7, and then exhale for 8 seconds. [7] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: A friendly hummingbird can mean you’re making new connections.
steps.content: A friendly hummingbird can mean you’re making new connections. A dream about having a pet hummingbird that follows you everywhere you go might be a sign that new friendships and romantic relationships are coming into your life. This can be your signal to meet new people and let love into your life by volunteering in your community, attending networking events, taking a class, or joining a dating app. Dreaming of a friendly hummingbird can also be a sign to nurture your existing relationships . Spend quality time with your friends, family, and partner, support them when they’re down, and appreciate their presence in your life.

steps.title: A hummingbird in your house can mean you’re holding yourself back.
steps.content: A hummingbird in your house can mean you’re holding yourself back. Seeing a hummingbird fly through your home in a dream might symbolize things that you want to achieve in life but that you feel too scared or powerless to reach for. This can be your sign to let go of your negative thoughts, develop your confidence, and take control of your life . Challenge negative thinking by replacing thoughts like, “I can’t do this,” or “I’m not good enough” with positive thoughts like, “I’m trying my best” or “I am smart and capable.” Then, motivate yourself to reach your goals by visualizing yourself achieving them, rewarding yourself when you check off your to-do list, and taking regular breaks.

steps.title: A hummingbird singing can mean good things are on the horizon.
steps.content: A hummingbird singing can mean good things are on the horizon. Hearing a hummingbird chirp and chitter in your dreams is considered a good omen that happiness, prosperity, and abundance are in store for you. You might land your dream job, get a promotion at work, take a much-needed vacation, or find your soulmate.

steps.title: Different colored hummingbirds can mean different things.
steps.content: Different colored hummingbirds can mean different things. The color of the hummingbird in your dream can affect the interpretation. In general, brighter colors infuse your dreams with positivity while darker colors might represent negative emotions and challenges ahead. More specifically: Blue hummingbirds represent tranquility, self-expression, and communication. Red hummingbirds symbolize love and passion. Yellow hummingbirds signify happiness and creativity. Green hummingbirds are associated with harmony, growth, and healing. White hummingbirds symbolize hope and spirituality. Black hummingbirds represent negative emotions, mystery, and transformation. Gray hummingbirds signify balance and neutrality. Brown hummingbirds symbolize stability and practicality.

steps.title: In Native American beliefs, hummingbirds are symbols of good luck.
steps.content: In Native American beliefs, hummingbirds are symbols of good luck. According to many Native American myths, hummingbirds are regarded as good omens that bring good fortune and health. In many legends, they are described as having healing abilities and going out of their way to help people and animals in need. [8] X Research source Several tribes use the hummingbird as their clan symbol, such as the Pueblo people.

steps.title: In Aztec beliefs, hummingbirds represent strength and the divine.
steps.content: In Aztec beliefs, hummingbirds represent strength and the divine. The hummingbird was believed to be the sacred animal of Huitzilopochtli, the Aztec god of the sun and war. Hummingbirds were revered for their strength and agility, so Huitzilopochtli often takes the form of the bird in myths. The Aztecs also believed that dead soldiers came back to life as hummingbirds. [9] X Research source Huitzilopochtli’s name comes from the Nahuatl word huītzilin which means “hummingbird.”

steps.title: In Mexican culture, hummingbirds symbolize power and magic.
steps.content: In Mexican culture, hummingbirds symbolize power and magic. Among many Mexican tribes, the hummingbird was prized for its beauty, swiftness, bravery, and ability to fight off birds much larger than itself. Some people believe that the hummingbird holds magical properties that give you inner strength and help you find love. [10] X Research source Some tribes also considered the hummingbird to be a symbol of resurrection. They noticed how hummingbirds go into a sleep-like state called torpor, which allows them to conserve energy.

steps.title: The swallow-tail hummingbird is a national symbol of Jamaica.
steps.content: The swallow-tail hummingbird is a national symbol of Jamaica. The swallow-tail hummingbird, also called the doctor bird, is renowned for its long, graceful tail. It is native to Jamaica and a central figure in folklore, where it’s believed to be a magical bird that’s the reincarnation of spirits. [11] X Research source

steps.title: In Shamanism, hummingbirds represent joy and healing.
steps.content: In Shamanism, hummingbirds represent joy and healing. According to shamanic religions, the hummingbird is thought to bring you happiness, love, good luck, and good health. They are believed to teach you how to let go, open your heart, and feel love and joy around you. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Write about your dreams when you wake up and look for themes.
steps.content: Write about your dreams when you wake up and look for themes. Analyzing your dreams can help you pick up on messages your subconsciousness or spirit guides are trying to send you. As soon as you wake up, write down everything you remember about your hummingbird dream. Then, determine if any of the feelings, situations, or themes in your dream relate to things happening in your waking life. In your dream journal, write down how you felt in the dream, who you were with, what you were doing, and where you were. For example, a dream about a hummingbird pecking at you while your partner simply watches might represent an argument you’re having with them that’s stressing you out.

steps.title: Cultivate hummingbird energy by planting plants and hanging feeders.
steps.content: Cultivate hummingbird energy by planting plants and hanging feeders. If you want to harness the good luck, joy, and resilient energy of the hummingbird in your waking life, attract hummingbirds into your yard. Simply fill your garden with native, nectar-producing plants like bee balm, honeysuckle, and sage. Then, hang hummingbird feeders full of homemade nectar. [13] X Trustworthy Source National Audubon Society Nonprofit environmental organization focused on conservation, citizen science, and public science education Go to source Hummingbirds are especially attracted to red, so plant red and orange flowers that are native to your area, like cardinal flower, paintbrush, and copper iris. [14] X Research source Learn more about hummingbirds to invite their energy into your life, too. Check out hummingbird guides from The National Audobon Society as well as on the Cornell Lab of Ornithology’s website .
